Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, courteous staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: gracerk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel March 28 to April 2, 2012. We've appreciated the value and consistant level of cleanliness at Ibis Hotels in the past so we chose one again for our stay in Barcelona. This one didn't let us down. It was clean and the staff were all courteous and helpful to us. They were especially helpful with getting our boarding passes printed - without cost to us. Although we used both the Llacuna and Glories metro stops in coming and going to the hotel the Glories stop has a walk to the hotel that feels much safer and is in a more pleasant neighborhood to look at so I would recommend using the Glories stop if arriving by metro at night. When you look at a map of the city the Llacuna stop looks much closer but it doesn't really seem to be any closer when actually comparing the walking times between the two stops and the hotel. We never eat the hotel breakfasts so I can't speak to how good they are. We love to get fresh European pain au chocolate and pain aux raisins plus cheese and apples for our breakfasts while in Europe and eat picnic-style in a park.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, practical, great value”
Reviews.Author: spinnerdolphin2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the IBIS near Plaza Glories in Barcelona March 12 to 19, 2012 with my 18 yr old son. The hotel is very clean and modern. The staff were kind enough to let us use the internet for free in 20 minute intervals but I appreciate they were restricted by corporate policy on that front. The breakfast did the job effectively and was better than your average continental spread. The room had a bit of the dormitory feel to it but we spent so little time there it hardly mattered. During the time we were there, the hotel was overrun with international school groups and while it didn't bother us I could imagine it annoying couples for example. Certainly true, access to the metro and the mall was easy. Rambla de la Poble Nou was our supper time destination and rather nice in that it was "Catalan" as opposed to "tourist". My son enjoyed the easy convenience to the Razzamatazz nightclub which was favoured by tourists. Only a couple of metro stops to all the things you go to Barca to see and the price was excellent. 5 out of 5 from us happy Canadians.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel ruined by poor staff and service”
Reviews.Author: ScottPJohnston
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the 2012 Barcelona Marathon. I usually stay in Ibis hotels across Europe so know what to expect. The hotel is located 5 minute walks away from two metro stations, one serving L1, the other serving L4. This means the door-to-door journey from the airport is 45 minutes by rail followed by metro. It is also 5 minutes from a large shopping centre. The proximity to the L1 line means the main attractions are 10 minutes away using the metro and, in the opposite direction, is a 10 minute walk to the beach and an extra 5 minutes to the marina and casino. However, I was so annoyed with the attitude of the staff that I would not stay again. I was called over by someone shouting "hey you" when they wanted to check my competition license for the race as I stayed on an Ibisport rate (which they should have done at check-in anyway). When they did this they had the cheek to tell me my valid UK and French running licenses were not genuine! One more thing irked me on my last day. I was told, contrary to other reviews on Tripadvisor, that the internet in the lobby is not free and you have to pay a daily charge. Outside of France, you usually have to pay for internet in your room but you get it free in the lobby. I was told that I would have to pay the daily room wifi rate to access the internet in the lobby, which I suspect was down to the fact they couldn't be bothered as their mates dropped round for a chat. The demenour of the staff was generally unwelcoming and unfriendly, pathetic for a hotel that has been opened for less than a year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Adventure2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the subway. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was pretty spacious and very clean. Breakfast was delicious and lots of variety. The staff were helpful and friendly. Wish the wifi was free but 5€ for 24 hours wasn't terrible (they had some desktops available in the lobby but you still had to buy the wifi access) A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for IBIS”
Reviews.Author: InterationalTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good IBIS hotel and a good choice if you want to save money. For a romantic getaway, maybe stay someplace a little nicer. As others have said, the location is ok, about 4 blocks from your choice of two metro stations (Glories and Llacuna). There isn’t much that I saw within a 3-block radius of the hotel, but there is a shopping mall up the street 4 blocks (near the very-easy-to-spot Agbar Tower and Glories metro) with El Burger King, El McD’s, El Subway, Carrefour supermarket, H&M, and many other stores; they’ve pretty much got you covered. This is a cut above your normal budget hotel. The hotel appears to be very new and was very clean. The rooms are well-designed to take full advantage of the modest space and use some savvy cost-cutting measures that you might notice but can live with (small flat-panel TV ~21 inches, power in only one place (two ports), desk chair is very cheap, combined shampoo/soap, no fridge, no Kleenex). Internet is 5 Euros for continuous 24 hours, so just add that right away to the stated price if you need it. At least it worked well. Staff was great and very helpful (especially the French guy). My 2nd floor room (3rd if you’re American) was very quiet and the shades block out the light extremely well (good for the jet-lagged who want to sleep in the day time). I was surprised to see a fitness center, consisting 4 cardio machines (2 treadmill, ellipse, and bike; sorry, no free weights) but a tourist is not likely to need any extra leg work. Airport: Catch the free bus shuttle to Terminal T2 then take the train to Clot, then take the metro back to Glories. It’s no more than a 8-minute walk from there. The T10 card is currently about 9.2 euros and covers 10 trips (with connections within about an hour), including to and from the airport. It’s a great value – just over $1 per trip including to the airport - and a no-brainer. In theory, it can be shared amongst a family. TIP: Take the 92 bus to Park Guell. It stops a lot, but is more convenient than the metro, which requires a long walk to get to the station and then another long walk (3/4 mile uphill) to get to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but its not the one.”
Reviews.Author: malcolmtalcum
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, clean and basic, everything you would expect from a chain like Ibis. The location is not bad either, 5 minutes either side of the hotel and you will hit a metro however there is nothing around the hotel in the way or eating or drinking. The staff were quite friendly but the information from the guy who was on the desk when we arrived was like pulling teeth even though his English was perfect, I'll put it down to a bad night. Free internet and theres a bar serving snacks etc open late. If I return to Barca I'll probably stay in somewhere closer to the city as the travelling in and out every time we needed to eat and drink etc wasted time.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money + good public transport links to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Somewhere_Special
Reviews.Content: Rooms are "standard Ibis" as you would expect from a hotel group - so basic furnishing, comfortable bed with no fuss. But this is the deal when you a paying at the lower end. Getting into the city centre (Plaza Catalunya for example) is easy by metro (5 mins walk from hotel), also connecting to the Tramvia and local buses is easy, again a 5 minute walk. My only issue is the TV was not working, and the bathroom towels are very very small. A complimentary bottle of water would be a good idea. Overall good value for money considering location and access to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: marius888 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is good, quite near to two metro stations. is quite clean and the service is ok, but the breakfast is poor. also the view from the rooms is not good. as a general opinion is reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far from downtown, but OK value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of a transitional neighborhood of warehouses and industrial parks, along with some newer office buildings. Reminds me a bit of SOMA in San Francisco. Not a great neighborhood after dark. As others have noted, within reasonable distance from two Metro stations, and about a short distance from Les Glories Mall and a longer walk to Diagonal Mall, both with supermarkets and wide range of dining options. You can walk to La Sagrada Familia, but it's at least 20 minutes. The rooms are typical IBIS rooms, almost glorified dorm rooms. The satellite TV is good though, with lots of stations, and a bilingual audio button that actually worked. Not pleased that they charged for wifi access. (You can go to the Burger King at the Les Glories mall for free wifi.) One oddity: I had bought some packets of ham wrapped in plastic and put them outside my window ledge to keep since there are no refrigerators. Every package disappeared, so there are either strong/strange winds or thieving seagulls/birds.

Reviews.Title: “The global standard”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo_Sadcovitz
Reviews.Content: No matter where you travel to Ibis Hotels are all the same. No surprise. Its is not centrally located, but subway is just a few steps. If you like Ibis, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice environment, poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and confortable, very nice environment in general, modern design. Thre was a big advertisement on the bar services, eventhough they couldn't delivery not even 10% of the menu. The location was a bit desert, no restaurants or stores nearby but the subway station is 2 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona December 2011”
Reviews.Author: zaymark Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel, the staff were very helpful, the breakfast was basic but plenty of it. It would be great to have WIFI in the room rate even for a few hours per day. Great location near the Glories Metro and located in the business district so perfect for quiet weekend stays, We always use Accor hotels when we travel, our last trip to Prague was just as good. Can recommend them to everyone

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: finkiminki
Reviews.Content: It is situated at about 10 minutes walking from the nearest metro stop and it was not quite easy to find it the first time. The room was small, but clean and simple. The staff was very helpful giving us directions and tourist information. There is also a big shopping center at about 5 minutes walking with a supermarket, restaurants and shops. It is a bit far from the center, so if you want to go to Plaza Catalunya or Rambla, you have to change the metro line at least twice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel for a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, as all Ibis I have ever been. A good suggestion is the book early to enjoy promotional fees. The only negative point is that internet access was paid, but only 5 EUR for 24h, less than you will pay at a lan house. I also recommend the "Canas and Tapas" bar at the near mall (great Sepia and Zetas).

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay just a bit expensive for what they offer”
Reviews.Author: snowlee
Reviews.Content: Great location and the taxi driver was so friendly while giving directions. The hotel stuff was helpful. Limited choice for breakfast buffet. The hotel room was pretty small and the bathroom needed some more maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SteB2011
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife visited this hotel on 11/11/11 to 14/11/11 (3 nights) for a weekend away in Barcelona. I chose this hotel as I have stayed in Ibis hotels before and have never been disappointed - you pretty much know you will get simple value for money. I booked about 3 months in advance via the website and payed 59eur per night. The hotel is located near to both Glories and Llacuna Metro stations which are only approx 5 mins (Glories) and 3 mins (Llacuna) walk away. From these stations it is only 5-10 mins on the Metro into the various areas of the city centre. The hotel is as you would expect from an Ibis - clean, tidy and hassle free. The room is relatively small but big enough for a weekend away, we hardley spent any time there as we wanted to explore Barcelona! Breakfast was 6,50eur each - good value for money for the expected continental type buffet. A large San Miguel was 3,00eur at the bar. The reception staff were friendly and gave us a tourist map when we arrived along with a booklet they had produced detailing local attractions and the best way to get to them. Overall Barcelona was an amazing place to visit, and if we ever return I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “500 METERS FROM GLORIES METRO .”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: good location.good breakfast .clean rooms and helpful stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: W2k
Reviews.Content: Ibis hotels are usually simplistic, yet clean and functional; this one is no different. It's located in a fairly dull part of Barcelona, down a one-way street which some taxi drivers have difficulty nativating, so public transport may be a better option. The room was okay, despite the large bed taking up most of the space it never felt cramped. Bathroom was below standard however, with poor drainage from the shower and no shower curtains, meaning the rest of the bathroom became flooded easily. Wi-Fi Internet access is available at cost (€5/24h), and works well. The breakfast buffet is small even by Ibis standards, but cheap (€6) and gets the job done. I would recommend this hotel for short stays when low cost is a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gianpippero
Reviews.Content: Close to 2 metro stations, very clean and great staff

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Barcelona break.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel well positioned a short walk from a Metro station then just a 4 stop ride to Barcelona centre.10 minutes more walking and you're at the beach.I think this hotel is for you if you are looking for quality accomodation at the budget end of the range.Very good value buffet breakfast for 6.50 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, unorganized personel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 weeks. The personel was friendly and the hotel was clean. My major complain: they messed up my bill 3 times and eventually (after leaving the hotel) I noticed that I had paid for an additional breakfast that I never took. These guys really need to get themselves organized with respect to budgeting or else they should be forced out of the market!

Reviews.Title: “I was here”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I like's very much staing at Ibis Hotel durig our holidays. The staff is all very helpful and hard-working and the room is excellent. Thanks for making our stay in Barcelona so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely close to where I was going to work and it also was the cheapest of all the near-by options. Pretty clean, nice room and service. I was only there for a night but it was a great choice. I'd definitely recommend Ibis at Barcelona without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Bog standard IBIS, ideal if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Matthew G
Reviews.Content: We had just come from a 3 day trip in Valencia and gone for a nice 4 star hotel. Unfortunately our budget couldn't stretch far enough to treat ourselves to the same luxury in Barcelona as we found similar hotels very expensive because Barcelona seems to be a bit overpriced. The Ibis is what you would expect, no frills. Positives about the room, large shower and there was a foreign sports channel mainly showing European football, which is a huge plus when you have to wait an hour plus for your better half to get ready to go out. Negatives, the towels provided are paper thin and just feel tired. There is also no safe facility. As for the area, the Glories appeared the closest Ibis to town. It is located in the middle of a business park area, so felt like a ghost town and walking towards the beach (15 min walk) was not the prettiest walk, also you get a nasty whaft of the drains and seweage, but i think that is a Barcelona issue altogether. There are 2 mini supermarkets nearby which is handy and a metrostation (Llacuna) a 5 min walk, which we used to jump on and get into town. To be honest, if you are on a budget, which we were, it's not a bad hotel (just make sure you bring your own towels) and our point was that we was hardly going to spend much time in the room anyway other than to lay our heads, and the beds are comfy and they have good aircon. You just have to do a bit of walking which in fairness we didn't mind doing.

Reviews.Title: “Close to metro station Llacuna”
Reviews.Author: giemeigi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to metro Llacuna; the bedroom and bathroom were really clean, but the towel's quality wasn't really good and not enough to uswe one for the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pretty basic hotel, not bad if you get a cheap deal. 20 mins walk to the beach and 5 mins to Glories shopping centre and Metro. Breakfast was basic as well but not bad cost. Despite offering bar food and snacks, I wouldn't recommend it as it is too expensive and essentially a microwave meal!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelstravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you expect from an Ibis: extremely basic facilities; however the location is very convenient for the new, trendy "@22" part of town (telecom and internet companies, design, etc). It is very close to the Llacuna metro station and next door to the Glories shopping mall. One can easily walk to the Olympic Port & beach.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a standard Ibis hotel. The location is not so good but it is close to Metro. So it is OK. Hotel staffs are very friendly. They will give you a simple guide of neighborhood area in which you can find a street called Rambla del Poblenou. Very nice street and you can find a few good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and friendly”
Reviews.Author: martysia-k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelona for one night. The rooms are smaller than on photos. One bed is normal but one is just like for a child. Toilets are clean. Breakfast is various, they offer spanish meat and cheese. We could leave our bags in the hotel after the night to go and see the city without them. Disatvantage: 15min walk to metro, area more industrial than homy, small rooms Advantage: cheap, good breakfast, near to the "cucumber ;-)", very nice staff Not for a long stay. Just for one night it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amethystDevon Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well sited between two metro stations. It offers everything you'd expect from an Ibis with regards to cleanliness and facilities. The staff are very friendly and very helpful and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - new - notnreally friendly”
Reviews.Author: kbisok
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel after a visit to family in france. The hitel is brand new, looks nice. Rooms are basic but functional. Breakfast is simple, some french bread etc in the lobby restaurant. Staff isn't really helpfull, i asked to stay in the room a little longer before my flight. But that was notmpossible, not even with my accor card status. That saod there was nothing to done to feel more appreciated because of loyalty status. The hotel is located in between 2 subway stops. About a 5 to 10minute walk to either of them.not much to do in the vicinity other then the pza glories mall.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place to stay near el poblenou”
Reviews.Author: lbo80
Reviews.Content: Nice welcome and friendly reception staff. Clean and modern rooms. Not in the centre but the information provided on arrival meant navigating around was not a problem. breakfast had a decent range and was good value. Good local options for food on rambla el poblenou, and a nice walk to the beach. Glories shopping mall is also nearby, as is the metro. A decent choice outside of the main tourist mayhem and to experience more low key and authentic Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Puppiespaws Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, it isn't in the best location if your looking for atmosphere at your door step as the hotel is located in the middle of nothing, BUT the metro is a short stroll that takes you to Barceloneta Beach and an awesome shopping complex with restaurants is less than 1km away which has a lovely atmposhere. We love staying at Ibis as you always get an Ibis quality with these hotels and this one was just as good! I especially loved the pizza on the 24 HR menu, I think it deserves a special mention as it was one of the nicest pizzas I've ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for explores of Barcelona, who want to have peaceful nights. Close to the metro station. There is an indoor parking plot which is very important in such cities.Friendly and helpful service. I strongly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Run down area, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanineOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: The area is quite run down with many abandoned buildings. Seemed like rejuvenation was in progress nearby. The staff were excellent, our room was great (we had stayed in Ibis hotels and knew to expect the small size). Location was out of the centre but not too far. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Barcelona !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Barcelona thanks to this hotel ! special price for the wonderful breakfast !!! will recommend this hotel specially to family with teenagers (good value) . Good point : location of the hotel near the center, near subway, easy access to all attractions...

Reviews.Title: “One night in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sarajo1964 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel very clean , little out of the way but just what we needed for a nights stay before going on a cruise from Barcelona, Good value for money . Bzr open till late , Breakfast more than adequate. About 20 mins in cab from the airport (approx 36 Euros)

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've arrived late (23) at the neighborhood around underground/metro was a little bit scary. We haven't found any signs to hotel, however it is situated quite close to metro (around 500m) Hotel was very clean, breakfast were excellent and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel ,good location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: angelaclaudiaC
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night at this hotel, the area has been changing in the last years and it's good. The subway is close to the hotel, there is a shopping mall very close with supermarket, food court cinemas,and many good stores like zara etc... Close to Agabar tower. In additiion you can take the tram and go to the beach. It was perfect. Tranportation was very good. From Barceloneta to the hotel 7 euros! in the evenning,by cab.Very close. There's a double deck but turistic that stops close to the hotel what was great. Very clean hotel with good towels, in addition the air conditionair was the best during my whole trip and the shower too. The ducha was amazing after a day walking around the city. The pillows were new and confortable so the bed. Wonderfull stay and would love to stay there again. The staff was ok too.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis 22@ Glories”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, relative nice neighborhood, in close range to metro and other kinds of transportation. Cleaning was ok, breakfast not so variety, must be improved. One other thing, in room 505 it is a must to have a toilet brush!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money paid .”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel. You have two subway metro stations nereby . Do not take room at last floor (six) because the watter preasure is low and in the night you will heare the Air Conditioning engine which is placed on top of the hotel . But mainly for 69 euro per night it was ok . Clean , ask for supplementary towels because they will give you only two .

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Suidar
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks new and the staff is friendly. The room was rather small as Ibis rooms always tend to be, but more importantly, it was clean and quiet as always too. Situated in a commercial district outside the city centre, the location is a bit of a disadvantage, but the subway station (5 min walk), the shopping center (10 min walk) and the beach (15 min walk) made up for it. And the price too. :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenJesper Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and of good standard. The location is not great but within walking distance to 2 metro stations. Ok area. The room is clean, a great bed, nice bathroom and a effective and quiete aircon. The service is great and the english skills are sufficient. They have 24 hour open bar which they promote by not having a minibar or a refrigiator in the room. This would be the perfect value for money hotel if they provide free wifi and a small refrigiator in the room. Overall ok value for money and would recomend

Reviews.Title: “Functional,however let down by some poor elements”
Reviews.Author: ytofbow
Reviews.Content: Clean, functional rooms and close to the Metro. However, a real mixed bag when it comes to the staff. Some were lovely and some just plain rude. The breakfast is what you'd expect, basic but does the trick. However, I made the mistake of ordering food from the bar in the evening and it was just plain awful. Don't get me wrong, I wasn't expecting much, I'm quite aware that the Michelin Guide has yet to adorn the establishment with a coveted star. Chicken and chips (how hard can it be?) was a boil in the bag, cramp inducing lump of something (chicken) served with a packet of crisps. I asked if it would be possible to have some ketchup. NO! So Ibis, top marks to your cleaners, and some of your front house staff. However, whilst your rooms and breakfasts fulfil the Ibis promise perfectly well, that stuff you put on your bar menu falls short of the "good honest value" category and in to the 'if you're enough of an idiot to buy it, we'll sell it to you' category. Just don't bother and leave some take away menus at reception please!

Reviews.Title: “Probably better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was nice and a decent value considering the location. Rooms were OK. The staff was polite, however denied me free internet access even though it was advertised to have it and I also have Platinum status with this hotel chain as a frequent customer. Additionally, was told I would be provided with a reputable taxi service since the one from the airport ripped us off. The one the hotel staff recommended ripped us off as well, even worse than the first. I recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Our opinion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good quality of service and helpful staff. It was reasonably well located being close to Metro, Tram and bus routes (about 15 minutes to the centre of Barcelona) and within walking distance of Avinguda Diagonal and Sagrada Familia. We felt that the hotel was very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better”
Reviews.Author: lady_samhain
Reviews.Content: Generally it´s a good place: clean, helpful staff, comfortable bed and pillows, silent, not far from metro station... But it´s really annoying the fact that there´s no sheets, only a edredon, and the air conditioning doesn´t work very well on freeze mode - I knew that´s cold outside, BUT I didn´t want to open the window and miss the quiet ambient. Besides that, the towels could be better - they´re so old! And (incredible how it still happens!) you have to pay for wi-fi! But overall it´s ok, maybe I overesimated based on Tripadvisor´s 95% of thumbs up. There´s a mall very near and it´s a pleasant walk to go to Sagrada Familia, but It´s a bit far from main turistic sites.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel. service was good. we stayed as part of a group that had done the bangers to barclona rally and we found it was not too far from the ramblas area where our party was being held. will no doubt be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jinacio1978
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation on this hotel by internet on its website. I got very good prices (267 euros for 3 nights), although no pre payment was required. Most of the staff was quite helpful and friendly, I asked for a silent room when I checked in and the atendant kindly picked one at the end of the corridor. Perfect night sleep after hard-walking days, good matress, spotless clean room. On the last day my flight was due to early night, when I checked out we could drop our luggage on the reception and enjoy our day without carrying all the stuff. The cons: a little "far" from Plaza Catalunya, Ramblas, Passeig de Gracia (main touristic area), but I dont mind ride 15 minutes more (and 3 - 4 stations) the metro to get to the hotel. Also the shower was too close to the wall, that makes a little harder the task of having a bath, but it was not a problem at all. There I had breakfast once, it was above my expectance though not superb. I stamp: RECOMMENDED !! JIBF - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: UtahCrowe61 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, helpful, and English speaking. The hotel isn't in the heart of the great stuff of Barcelona (La Rambla, Gaudi, La Sagra Familia) but it is an easy walk to the Metro. The breakfast was well worth the 6.50 Euro and was served until noon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First let me say that you need to get the breakfast, you will be sorry if you don't. It cost about 6 EURO when you book the room, but me and my girlfriend loved it, and it was always packed because of the great food, drinks, they serve. Everything is fresh. The Hotel is at the perfect distance from Las Ramblas and the Barceloneta , the clubbing area. Last timed I stayed near the other places but it was so loud, so we decided to not to stay so close to the action, and it paid off because it was more affordable, but better, and at the same time a cab drive from the scene was only 6 or 7 euros, if you do not feel like walking. But from all the eating you will be doing, it is good to walk a bit. When we did not want to walk, the metro stop is only 2 blocks (5 minutes walk if you are slow) from the hotel, and it would cost you about 1.45 EURO to get to the hot spots from the station. The staff is also great, friendly, and they guarantee that they will fix any problem you got within 15 minutes or you will stay for free. 1 hour of free internet per day, in WiFi, or at the loung which has nice touch screen HP computers. They also got a 24HR snack bar, if you want something at 3 AM, the receptionist will get it for you, just choose from the snack bar. Their coffee and hot chocolate is to die for. You cannot beat their price for the comfort and service you get.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable Option”
Reviews.Author: CityMouseBK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis while in town for a work-related conference, and found it to be spotless, quiet, and comfortable. It’s not particularly close to the attractions; it’s located in more of a residential area. However, you’re a three-block walk to the Llacuna metro stop on the yellow line (a little farther in the other direction to Glories), where it’s a six-minute ride to Jaume I, home to the Picasso Museum and various other attractions. The hotel itself was built recently, so you’ll get a clean and comfortable room, with a flat-screen TV that shows Sky News and CNN International in English, as well as various other Spanish and French channels. I used my own hotspot, but there’s wireless Internet access available. There’s a safe in the lobby for valuables (you get one key, front desk keeps the other), and a bar and snacks that are available 24-7. Overall, if you like to walk out your door and be steps from the sites, this is not your place. But if you can handle a subway system (and Barcelona’s system is pretty easy; just remember you have to open the doors yourself) and read a map, a hotel like this for 79 Euros is a bargain in an otherwise expensive city. As I said, there’s not much in the actual neighborhood, but there are plenty of options a few subway stops away. The view from a room in the back will also be an office park of sorts; front rooms will overlook the street. From the airport, a taxi cost me about 35 Euros (I printed out a Google Maps map and the address and showed to the driver at the airport and he found it without problem) and about 45 Euros going to the airport because of some airport fee they have. If you need a taxi to the airport, tell the front desk the night before and they’ll book one for you. The staff was also very friendly and they all spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “What Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I normally (about 30 to 50 nights a year) try to stay at Novotel and Ibis hotels, around Spain and Portugal, mainly because I always know what to expect, and the price is acceptable. Never the less this was the first time I stayed in the Ibis in Barcelona. I am afraid to say that out of all of them it was by far the worst. The staff where miserable, the car park extremely tight and the charge for the use of the internet, are the beginning, the location is appalling, in a horrible area of the city, the staff could not even recommend a restaurant nearby. I will definitely not be stopping at that Ibis again.

Reviews.Title: “Very wise choice”
Reviews.Author: DashPL
Reviews.Content: Ibis Pza Glories is very good choice in Barcelona. It's located next to Torre Akbar, close to metro station, just 2 or 3 stops from main city spots. There's a shopping center nearby, with nice choice of cafes, restaurants etc. Room was ok - very clean and very comfortable. It's great choice, you'll probably won't be able to get so good hotel in Barcelona for such a good price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising good for the money”
Reviews.Author: CurioserNCurioser
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, surprisingly cheerful. Thought the value for money was very good, esp. internet rate. Other comments about the district miss the point - it is in an area of industrial heritage which is being gentrified - dotted throughout the new blocks and building sites are the tall chimneys of the ceramic factories that once filled the area. Its an easy 5-10 minute walk to Glories and the restaurants at its centre, and a few blocks east takes you to a major pedestrianised street for the evening paseo. Llacuna L4 metro station is just 2-3 blocks away, so you are 20 minutes from the old city centre. Rooms are functional but squeaky clean, they might have benefited from softer pillows but otherwise fine. Walk-in shower rather than a bath. Staff are pleasant and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: thegorbs Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 15min away from the city centre via the metro, it did seem to be in a bit of a run-down neighbourhood, perhaps this was only because it was winter? The room was a pleasant size, offering satellite channels in Spanish, clean bathroom and a hairdryer! The towels were replaced daily, there was no sign to state otherwise. The snack and drink bar was cheap, and handy, as there appeared to be a lack of eating venues around the hotel. The only other "annoying" thing was they only gave 1 room key between the 2 of us, but gave out another one when we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the problem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There are no real quality restaurants within walking distance save the Novotel up the street. But during a long stay, who wants the same restaurant? Taxis become a necessity late at night. However, many drivers from the city center did not seem to know about the hotel. An address with you is a must. Also the hotel lists Glories as the metro station. It is up a hill and must be reached in an indirect way because of all the construction. Walking three flat blocks in the opposite direction to Line 4 at Llacuna is more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “I liked Ibis Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Ibis was one of the nice one's. It is a relativity newly built hotel. Very clean and presented. The room was nice and tidy and on 6th floor, had a good view and the hotel as a whole is away from the traffic noise. Which also means it is not with in easy walking distance to the main tourism areas and shopping, but a quick walk down the road to Metro and it's 10 minutes tops into town. I liked this Ibis out of all the Ibis' I stayed at in my Oct-Nov travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay for Euro 79”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good place, worth the stay. train stations are walking distance, quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “twin rooms not suitable for 2 adults”
Reviews.Author: shamc21
Reviews.Content: the rooms advertised as twin room are not, they have a double and a tiny pull out bed, not suitable for 2 adults sharing, staff not always as helpful as could of been, but clean, close to metro and connections

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Barcelona Pza Glories 22
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Ciutat de Granada 99, 08018 Barcelona, Spain
